resources.string: We would like to thank the following websites for extending their support to us.

*Every Morning you will get a notification popup which will help you develop a new concept in the world of programming.\n *With these tips you will get to develop some extra skills that you might not get anywhere else.
*Along with the tips you will get information regarding the contests on that day.

Description:

The aim of this app is to help beginners know the basics required to get comfortable with competitive programming. When a person starts competitive programming, he generally gets confused from where to start, thats where the role of this app comes. The questions are divided in 12 parts, each focussing on a particular skillset required for a good programmer to know. To help new budding hackers :p , we have included a daily pop-up reminder which will give them a question sorted in a particular order to get them on the track.

Daily a pop will come at 9:00 am, user can enable and disable the pop-up notifications with the buttons provided below.

Welcome to Scheduler! This sample demonstrates how you can schedule an alarm that causes a service to be started. This is useful when you want to schedule alarms that initiate long-running operations. Click START ALARM to activate an alarm to check the Google home page for a custom doodle once a day. If the app finds a doodle, it posts a \"Doodle Alert\" as a notification. Click CANCEL ALARM to cancel the alarm. Once the alarm is active, it automatically restarts when the device is rebooted.
There is a Google doodle today!!

There are many platforms available for you to learn, improve and develop your coding skills.

 To get you started with, there is:

 1.) CodeChef ( a Directi initiative ) which holds monthly 3 contests:

 		a) Long Challenge
 		b) Short Challenge
 		c) Lunch time
 apart from many other college level contests.

 2.) Codeforces which also holds short contests very frequently. It holds contests for separately newbies/learners having less rating and for Advanced programmers.

 3.) SPOJ which have a vast number of good problems to deal with.

 4.) TopCoder where you can earn also :P


Links are available below.
